12:31 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:35 <evalica> vmassol: if we don't encourage comments on xwiki.org we might disable them  
12:36 <j-simard> has quit  
12:36 <vmassol> we do encourage comments  
12:36 <vmassol> what we don't encourage is questions  
12:36 <evalica> k :)  
12:37 <vmassol> but yes I agree there's something to do  
12:37 <vmassol> not sure what though  
12:37 <vmassol> there are 2 possibilities I can imagine  
12:37 <vmassol> 1) display a text with a link to the forum  
12:37 <evalica> reputation system :)  
12:38 <vmassol> 2) add a new feature in xwiki so that comments are also sent to the list and when responding they are added as comments to the page  
12:38 <vmassol> (ludovic worked on that a long time ago)  
12:38 <evalica> 3) add a 'do you have questions?' panel  
12:39 <evalica> actually a version of your 1)  
12:39 <evalica> the problem with comments is that they become deprecated very easily, but they persist on the page  
12:40 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
12:42 <vmassol> has quit  
12:44 <evalica> vmassol1: not sure is related, but I noticed yesterday that the e.x.o livetable displays multiple occurrences of the same entries. For example http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#|t=extensions&p=1&l=30&s=doc.creationDate&d=desc&name=csv&type=snippet  
12:45 <evalica> a.k.a Type: Snippet Name: csv - will show 4 results instead of one  
12:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:45 <evalica> Name: Remove - will show 4 results for 'Remove object from page'  
12:46 <vmassol1> has quit  
12:50 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
12:50 <vmassol> has quit  
12:52 <evalica> vmassol1: I reported here http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XINFRA-125

13:55 <mflorea> has quit  
13:55 <sburjan> guys, it seems that  With MySQL 5.5, InnoDB becomes the default storage engine. Did we know about this ?  
13:59 <tmortagne> sburjan: where did you see that ?  
14:00 <sburjan> Starting from MySQL 5.5.5, the default storage engine for new tables is InnoDB.  
14:00 <sburjan> http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/innodb-default-se.html  
14:00 <sburjan> but we are already forcing InnoDB already form Hibernate config, right ?  
14:01 <tmortagne> sburjan: yes we are forcing innodb anyway  
14:01 <tmortagne> by default  
14:02 <tmortagne> you can always configure hibernate conf the way you want  
14:02 <sburjan> thanks, just wanted to make sure  
14:03 <tmortagne> a more interesting change for us would be for mysql to put UTF8 by default  
14:19 <vmassol> evalica: some question for you on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Junco+Skin?viewer=comments#xwikicomment\_0 ;)  
14:21 <evalica> :)

16:54 <vmassol> sdumitriu: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9601  
16:55 <sdumitriu> Thanks  
16:55 <vmassol> the question is: should we release 5.2.1 now, wait a bit or just wait for 5.3 which is not in too long?  
16:56 <sdumitriu> +1 for 5.2.1  
16:57 <vmassol> the problem is that it takes time to release a version… so we might want to wait a bit  
16:57 <vmassol> in case there are other problems  
16:57 <vmassol> I've found 2 in not long, there might be more related to this same change  
17:13 <vmassol> tmortagne:  
17:13 <vmassol> would be good to have the fix for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-484 in 5.2.1 too  
17:14 <tmortagne> vmassol: ok  
17:14 <vmassol> thanks
